title: Systems of Equations - Matrix Operations - Part A

content.question: Part A Write, but do not solve, a system of linear equations that is equivalent to <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>L</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>y</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>7</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4625@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
